conclusion: Analyzing the forces involved on the metal rod.
Identify the relevant forces: weight of the rod, spring forces, magnetic force.
In initial equilibrium with current I1, magnetic force balances the weight, springs don't stretch.
Weight of the rod is mg, where m is mass and g is gravity.
Magnetic force on a current-carrying wire is F = I L B sinθ.
Since magnetic field is perpendicular, sinθ = 1, so F = I L B.
For current I1, magnetic force balances weight: I1 L B = mg.
For current I2 from b to a, determine magnetic force direction using right-hand rule.
With current I2, magnetic force is upward.
Set up force equation for current I2: I2 L B - mg - 2kΔx = 0.
Substitute mg = I1 L B into equilibrium equation: (I2 - I1)L B = 2kΔx.
Solve for elongation: Δx = (I2 - I1)L B / 2k.
Final answer: Elongation of each spring is Δx = (I2 - I1)L B / 2k.
